Award.AwardTitle: Workshop on Quantum Trajectory Methods; July 28-30, 2008, Los Alamos, NM
Award.AbstractNarration: Lionel (Bill) Poirier of Texas Tech University and Brian Kendrick of Los Alamos National Laboratory are supported by an award from the Theoretical and Computational Chemistry program to partially support the costs of holding a Workshop on Quantum Trajectory Methods. This workshop, to be held July 28-30, 2008 at Los Alamos, will bring together investigators to discuss a very controversial method, Bohmian Mechanics, that has stimulated a great deal of research and a lot of strongly-held opinions. The workshop will likely be the first place that supporters and detractors of this technique are brought together to discuss this technique. The participant/speaker list is very diverse and includes people from both sides of the controversy, so it is likely to be a lively meeting. The support is primarily to ensure the participation of postdocs and graduate students.
